content.webTitle: Cesc Fábregas maintains innocence over spitting furore against Hull

fields.headline: Cesc Fábregas maintains innocence over spitting furore against Hull
fields.bodyText: Cesc Fábregas will go before an independent three-man commission to be judged on the misconduct charge which arose from the flashpoints that followed Arsenal's FA Cup victory over Hull City on 17 March, having indicated he will plead not guilty. The Arsenal captain was charged by the Football Association for entering the field afterwards to confront some of Hull's players and for allegedly spitting at the Hull assistant manager, Brian Horton, in the tunnel. Fábregas, for whom today marks the deadline for his plea, has maintained his innocence on the allegation of spitting.
